Constructor Detail

Client

private Client()
The constructor is private since the class is a singleton.
In the constructor are setted up the class logger and is indicated as the preferred server handler the socket server handler.

Since:
May 29, 2011@5:16:41 PM

getIpHost

public static java.lang.String getIpHost()
The method getIpHost returns the host IP address to whom the client wants to connect.

Returns:
a string containing the IP address of the server (it could be in the IPv4 or IPv6 format, it has to be checked manually) or null if there is no such address.
See Also:
ServerHandler, ClientMainWindow

getPort

public static int getPort()
The method getPort returns the host port that the client wants to use to connect to the server.

Returns:
a integer representing the port number used by the client server communication.
See Also:
ServerHandler, ClientMainWindow

getServerHandler

public static ServerHandler getServerHandler()
The method getServerHandler returns the current server handler used by the client to connect to the server (by default the SocketServerHandler).

Returns:
the reference to the current server handler the client to connect to the server (by default the SocketServerHandler)
See Also:
RMIServerHandler, SocketServerHandler

getToken

public static java.lang.String getToken()
The method getToken return the current token assigned to the client by the server at the login used for all of the client server communication.

Returns:
a string representing the token given by the server at the login.
See Also:
RMIServerHandler, SocketServerHandler

getUsername

public static java.lang.String getUsername()
The method getUsername returns the username choosen by the client to register and login into the server.

Returns:
a string representing the username of the client
See Also:
ServerHandler

setIpHost

public static void setIpHost(java.lang.String theIpHost)
The method setIpHost set the host IP address to whom the client wants to connect.

Parameters:
theIpHost - string containing the IP address of the server (it could be in the IPv4 or IPv6 format, it has to be checked manually) or null if there is no such address.
See Also:
ServerHandler, ClientMainWindow

Parameters:

ServerHandler, ClientMainWindow

setServerHandler

public static void setServerHandler(ServerHandler theServerHandler)
The method setServerHandler set the current server handler used by the client to connect to the server.

Parameters:
theServerHandler - the serverHandler to be set as current
See Also:
RMIServerHandler, SocketServerHandler

setToken

public static void setToken(java.lang.String theToken)
The method setToken is used to set the current token assigned to the client by the server at the login used for all of the client server communication.

Parameters:
theToken - the token to be set as current
See Also:
ServerHandler

setUsername

public static void setUsername(java.lang.String theUsername)
The method setUsername is used to set the current username chosen by the client to register a new user and to login in the server. The username is chosen using a GUI class in the ClientMainWindow class.

Parameters:
theUsername - the username of the client
See Also:
ClientMainWindow
